comment: Professor Gray was truly a great instructor. She is very understanding and focuses on one's individual writing. She truly wants you to improve and do well. My class was a hybrid course so we only met once a week. She's light on work and an easy grader. Attendance is mandatory but she gave us 6 free absences.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Honestly, Professor Gray is a genuine English professor. Though her class is as rigorous as a normal university English class, she is very mellow and the essays, projects, and work she gives are very easy. If you want an English professor who is very easy to talk to, relateable, supportive, and fun, take Professor Gray.

Professor Gray is extremely nice and easy going. She can be a bit unorganized but once she lets you know what you're supposed to do exactly the work is simple. You basically work on a research paper all semester and it's a group paper. I would definitely take her again! Easy A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GROUP PROJECTS--Would take again

comment: This entire class is based on LGBTIQ papers and discussions (its even on the syllabus). I felt like we were just going in circles throughout the entire course. Only two papers (basically over the same thing). Overall really easy, just felt repetitive.

Professor Gray is the best prof ever! She's so helpful and even gives help in class about other class while telling us what to do about other difficult teachers. Everything in her class is very clear and she always tries to help us all. If I ever have the chance to take her again I 100% will because she is actually doing her work so well!!
Professor Gray is an excellent professor! She gives in-depth feedback, and can really help you boost your English papers. I 100% recommend her!
Prof. Gray is very sweet in my opinion. There aren't too many essays in her class, and she gives good feedback on them.

Get ready to be kicked in your non-gender specified nads by the politically correct foot of this progressive. Dive straight into your second semester of college, you special little snowflakes, and be pampered by getting to pick your very own pronoun for the class to be bullied into referring to you by! Get ready to write about LGBT and nothing else
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Gave good instructions and If they weren't clear she gave extra time. Great feedback and she made some of her own instructional videos which were very helpful. She also provided the book material online.

(Hybrid) 4 papers: Source Analysis, Source Comparison, Research Paper, and Final Exam (a revision of one of your previous 3 papers, as well as a short "narrative essay" on the changes you made and why). Discussion posts are just there for peer review. Have her review your paper before you turn it in and you should be fine. Take her, she's great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria
